summary: The Journalist Protection Act amends Title 18 of the United States Code to penalize assaults against journalists. It defines 'journalist' broadly, encompassing those who gather and disseminate news via various media. The bill differentiates between bodily injury and serious bodily injury inflicted upon a journalist, with corresponding penalties of up to 3 or 6 years imprisonment and/or fines, respectively. The act covers assaults during newsgathering or intended to intimidate or impede newsgathering.
